article.description:
Bonzi Wells banked in a running one-hander with 1.4 seconds left in double overtime to give the Portland Trail
Blazers a 112-110 victory over the Atlanta Hawks on Wednesday night.

related.description:
Glenn Robinson was ejected in the third quarter of the Atlanta Hawks' game Wednesday against the Portland Trail
Blazers.
related.linkText: Big Dog ejected for arguing with official
related.title: Robinson won't back away from ref, gets booted
related.headline: Robinson won't back away from ref, gets booted

article.headline: Wells has tough night, but shoots Hawks down at end
article.linkText: Bonzi can't buy bucket until winner in second OT
article.story:
ATLANTA (AP) -- Bonzi Wells had no trouble putting his game-winning basket in perspective. "The biggest shot I've hit since I've been this league,'' he said. "I'm just happy I went from having the worst game to having a pretty good game. That's how the NBA is.'' Wells banked in a running one-hander with 1.4 seconds left in the second overtime to give the Portland Trail Blazers a 112-110 victory Wednesday night over the Atlanta Hawks. Wells was dribbling at the top of the key when he drove past Corey Benjamin and hit a 6-footer to give the Blazers their fourth win in five games. "We had a chance to take this team out early,'' said Scottie Pippen, who led Portland with seven assists. "We just didn't play the kind of basketball we needed to put this team away. "When you're on the road, you have to play smarter, and I don't think we played smart basketball when we had the lead.'' Atlanta lost its sixth straight. Derek Anderson had 21 points to lead the Blazers, who led by as many as 18 midway through the second quarter before allowing the Hawks to go on 29-10 run that ended with Shareef Abdur-Rahim's tip-in with 6:50 left in the third quarter. Less than two minutes later, Glenn Robinson, Atlanta's leading scorer, was ejected for arguing with official Scott Wall, but the Hawks led by as many as five on Abdur-Rahim's 15-footer with 11:54 left in regulation. The lead changed hands twice in the final 35.1 seconds of regulation. Anderson, Portland's best free-throw shooter, missed two foul shots at the 14.9 mark, and Atlanta, after calling timeout, got a thunderous dunk from Benjamin to take a 96-95 lead with 4.9 seconds to go. Theo Ratliff, though, fouled Wells as he drove the lane, and the Portland swingman hit one of two free throws to send the game into overtime. On his game-winner, Wells saw Abdur-Rahim jumping to try and block his path, so he put some arc on the shot. He was just glad Portland coach Maurice Cheeks showed faith in him. "Not since I was in college,'' said Wells, a former Ball State standout. "The coach never had enough confidence in me to let me have the last shot.'' Benjamin, signed to a 10-day contract earlier in the day, sent the game into double overtime with a putback basket off the glass at the buzzer after Abdur-Rahim intentionally missed a free throw. Lead referee Bob Delaney reviewed the play on instant replay, ruling that Benjamin got the shot off before the horn sounded. "I was just persistent to get the rebound. I won it,'' said Benjamin, who was signed out of the NBDL. "I started from the free-throw line and ran in. I wanted it. I was aggressive. I'm hungry. I'm trying to do whatever I can do to be around here.'' The Blazers let Atlanta back in the game by shooting 4-of-22 and getting outscored 26-12 in the third quarter. "We just went flat in the second half, but we hung in there,'' Cheeks said. "We stayed with them. They had a chance to close the game out.'' Abdur-Rahim led the Hawks with 27 points and 11 rebounds. Jason Terry had 23 and 11 assists, and Dion Glover, making his second start of the season, had a season-high 21. Zach Randolph scored 20 for Portland, which got 17 rebounds from Dale Davis.

Game notes
Benjamin played 24 minutes and scored eight points on 3-for-10 shooting, including 1-for-5 on 3-point attempts. ... Portland reserve center Chris Dudley, activated from the injured list after missing the entire season with left side sacroiliac pain, played four minutes. ... Ruben Boumtje Boumtje, signed Monday when Blazers star center Rasheed Wallace was suspended seven games following a postgame confrontation with referee Tim Donaghy, was placed on the injured list with a sore knee. ... Hawks guard Mike Wilks didn't return after dislocating his right thumb in the second quarter.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
